description:
Teiai Group is one of Japan's largest firms. Yukio Tonegawa, a man with a larger-than-life presence and sharp intellect, works as the right-hand man of Chairman Kazutaka Hyodo. One day, the chairman commands Tonegawa to spearhead "Game of Death," an evil project that employs debtors. He rallies his direct reports and scrambles to form Team Tonegawa, only to encounter a barrage of challenges from the erratic chairman and his disloyal employees, ultimately leading to his demotion.

Team Tonegawa is bombarded with an onslaught of wide-ranging problems! "Mr. Tonegawa - Middle Management Blues -" is a spinoff of "Kaiji," the hit manga series that boasts a total circulation of over 20 million printed copies.

(Source: Nippon TV)

Note: Episode 14-15, parts of 18, and parts of 20-23 of this entry adapts the Kaiji spin-off manga Ichinichi Gaishutsuroku Hanchou.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Bowling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of Bowling.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Pandemic
tags.description: Prominently features a disease prevalent over a whole country or the world.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Camping
tags.description: Features the recreational activity of camping, either in a tent, vehicle, or simply sleeping outdoors.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

node.description:
Nobuyuki Fukumoto is a Japanese manga artist well known throughout the Far East for his unique original gambling ideas, deep psychological analysis of characters and distinct artstyle. Yakuza and gambling are recurring themes in his manga.

In English language countries, he is most famous as the author of Akagi, a mahjong-related manga. In 1998, he won the Kodansha Manga Award for Tobaku Mokushiroku Kaiji. An onomatopoeia "zawa" (ざわ‥), meaning uneasy atmosphere, appears frequently in his comics and is considered Fukumoto's trademark.

Hagiwara is a former assistant of the mangaka [Akiko Higashimura](https://anilist.co/staff/99186/Akiko-Higashimura).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hagitenten)

Born on December 27, 1976. Chiba Prefecture, Japan. Pistol Takehara was born as Kazuo Takehara. He is an actor and composer, known for The Long Excuse (2016), The Genkiya (2012) and Freesia: Bullet Over Tears (2007). [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/takehara-pistol/297444667)
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.
**Sugiyama Shinji (杉山晋史)** is a Japanese art designer and background artist.

__[Website](http://yamadaman.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_yamadaman_)__

__Birthplace:__ Kyoto Prefecture, Japan

__Takahiro Yamada__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

__Genres:__ Emo, Alternative Metal, Alternative Rock, Screamo, Metal core, Post/Hardcore, Loud Rock

__[Website](https://noisycell.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/noisycell_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/noisycell_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChhajU3mFRcSX1HimGCHF-g/featured)__

__Introduction:__
NoisyCell (ノイジーセル) is a Japanese rock band. They are under the label Bop (2014-), and their office is also associated with Bop.

__Biography:__
The band formed in 2007 with the core members being Ryosuke and Ryo, the band was based on a copy band, originally focusing on uploading works on the net using vocaloids, etc, but when Kiyoshi joined, they started live activities in Tokyo. After Kiyoshi's retirement, various support members were involved, and Kiara and Tatsuya joined the band, becoming main members.

__Members:__
- [Ryosuke](https://anilist.co/staff/152597/Ryosuke) - vocalist, guitarist (2007-)
- [Ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/152595/Ryo) - guitarist, screams, programming (2007-)
- Kiara - bass guitarist (2016-)
- Tatsuya - drummer (2016-)

__Former Members:__
- Kiyoshi - drummer (2013-2016)
- Chiharu - bass guitarist (unknown)

(Source: [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/NoisyCell))
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [light novel author](https://anilist.co/staff/250535/)._

__Birthplace:__ Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Daughter:__ [Ryouko Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120430)

__Atsushi Maekawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter for anime, while he also occasionally writes lyrics for music.

Graduated: Aichi University of the Arts (March, 2007)

Kotono Watanabe is a Japanese director and storyboard artist, who mainly does episode direction. After her graduation from Aichi University she joined studio Madhouse in April of the same year.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/reiko_0157) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=reiko_nagasawa)

Reiko Nagasawa is an animator and character designer, raised and currently affiliated with Madhouse. She started her career in 2014 as an in-betweener for the studio. In 2021, she debuted as a character designer for [takt op.Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/131565/takt-opDestiny/).

Married to fellow animator [Tooru Iwasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/131949/Tooru-Iwasawa).
